page.title: 08SHEPWAY CARE FOR THE ELDERLY
page.content: The estate now has a far greater proportion of old people compared with its original population. A warden makes regular visits and is on emergency call to elderly residents. Coach outings are organised by Cambridge House, an attractive day centre and residential home. A new development of self-contained bungalows and flats with a community lounge and site warden opens soon. The W.V.S. provides meals on wheels while St Martin's Church, celebrating its silver anniversary (1985), runs a weekly luncheon club and operates a care scheme. Quarterly meetings are held co-ordinating services for the estate. The Borough Council supplies 23 pounds' worth of tokens (1985) for each pensioner's use on local bus routes, and on express train and coach services to London.
